contrive.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to succeed in doing something in spite of difficulties
contrive.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Schindler contrived to save more than 1,000 Polish Jews from the Nazis.
contrive.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to arrange an event or situation in a clever way, especially secretly or by deceiving people
contrive.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The lawsuit says oil companies contrived the oil shortage in the 1970s.
contrive.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to make or invent something in a skilful way, especially because you need it suddenly
contrive.translation[0].definitions[2].e: In 1862, a technique was contrived to take a series of photographs showing stages of movement.
